snippet: As with many of the other improvised solutions to the euro zone’s problems, the $650 billion European Stability Mechanism’s reality is less elegant than the theory behind it.
abstract: Reality of European Stability Mechanism, or the 500 billion euro European bailout fund, is less elegant than theory behind it, as with many of the other improvised solutions to euro zone's problems; disagreements persist among finance ministers over the bailout fund's workings and its ability to raise money.
lead_paragraph: As with many of the other improvised solutions to the euro zone’s problems, the $650 billion European Stability Mechanism’s reality is less elegant than the theory behind it.

headline.seo: Uncertainty Remains About How to Use European Bailout Fund
headline.main: Europe Still at Odds Over the Workings of Its Bailout Fund
headline.print_headline: Lingering Questions About a New Resource For the Euro Arsenal
